snippet: At the end of the N.F.L. regular season, no coach or general manager who failed to reach the playoffs has any real job security, except if you happen to be working in Philadelphia or San Diego.
abstract: Analysis holds that at the end of the NFL regular season, no coach or general manager who failed to reach the playoffs has any real job security, except if you happen to be working in Philadelphia or San Diego; Andy Reid will be coach for the Philadelphia Eagles another season and both general manager AJ Smith and coach Norv Turner will be back with the San Diego Chargers for 2012.
lead_paragraph: At the end of the N.F.L. regular season, no coach or general manager who failed to reach the playoffs has any real job security, except if you happen to be working in Philadelphia or San Diego.

headline.seo: In N.F.L. Front Offices, Coming, Going and Staying Put
headline.main: In N.F.L. Front Offices, Coming, Going and Staying Put
headline.print_headline: In N.F.L. Front Offices, Coming, Going and Staying Put
